intro: Galium harcynicum var. arvernense, commonly known as the Arvernian bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild sedative and anti-inflammatory properties.
